post.description: Searches purchase order by a number of parameters, such as Date of Purchase, status, reference number. Returns paged result of purchase order header. Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.SearchPurchaseOrderNode

Searches purchase order by a number of parameters, such as Date of Purchase, status, reference number. Returns paged result of purchase order header. Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.SearchPurchaseOrderNode
Creates initial purchase order in pending status. Once PO is created you can add stock items to it. Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Update purchase order header, only if status is not Delivered. Returns modified/recalculated purchase order header Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Delete, add and update purchase order items and cause purchase order totals recalculation Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Method adds purchase order item to an existing PENDING order. Items can only be added to PENDING purchase orders. Returns class that represents modified/recalculated purchase order header and modified purchase order item line Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Update purchase order item, quantity, cost, pack size, pack quantity, in PENDING order only. Returns class that represents modified/recalculated purchase order header and modified purchase order item line Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Delete purchase order item line from PENDING order. Returns recalculated/modified purchase order header Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Gets a list of Purchase Order Ids that contain undelivered stock items Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.SearchPurchaseOrderNode
Get purchase order header and items in one call Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Get purchase order notes Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Add purchase order note Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Delete Note for Purchase Order Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Change purchase order status. Can change from: PENDING to OPEN, which will populate Due (OnOrder) values in stock levels, OPEN to DELIVERED, which will consolidate Due values in stock levels PARTIAL to DELIVERED, which will consolidate Due values in stock levels Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Update purchase order item, quantity, cost, pack size, pack quantity, in PENDING order only. Returns class that represents modified/recalculated purchase order header and modified purchase order item line Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.DeliverPurchaseOrderNode
Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.DeliverPurchaseOrderNode

Update purchase order item, quantity, cost, pack size, pack quantity, in PENDING order only. Returns class that represents modified/recalculated purchase order header and modified purchase order item line Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.DeliverPurchaseOrderNode

Deliver purchase order item. This will affect current stock level according to the delivered quantity. You can specify the total number of delivered items. If all items are delivered, the purchase order status will be changed to delivered Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.DeliverPurchaseOrderNode
Get a list of available statuses
Delete a Purchase Order Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Get the Audit Log of a Purchase Order. Returns maxium 1000 records in descending order Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Get all purchase order extended properties Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode

Adds extended properties to a purchase order. Property name must be unique otherwise the method throws an error. Maxium number of extended properties allowed for a single purchase order is 50. If total count of extended properties exceeds 50 an error will be thrown. Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Updates purchase order extended property by id. If supplied id doesn't exists, the routine will throw an error The routine checks for duplicated propery names and throws an error if duplicated property name. Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Delete extended property items by id Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Get purchase order additional costs types
Add new additional cost type Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ChangeAdditionalTypesNode
Update additional cost type Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ChangeAdditionalTypesNode
Delete additional cost type Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ChangeAdditionalTypesNode

Modify purchase order additional costs. You can add new lines, update and delete existing. The method will return modified list back to you with each record identified by unique identifier. Purchase Order header will also be returned with new total recalculated Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Get additional costs of a purchase order Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Modify additional cost allocation items Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Modify purchase order payment statements. You can add new lines, update and delete existing. The method will return modified list back to you with each record identified by unique identifier. Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode
Get payment statements of a purchase order Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Try to find an item by SKU of SpplierCode Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Get delivered item records for specific PO Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Get delivered item records for specific PO Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Get the URL of the CSV file for the specific purchase order Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.ViewPurchaseOrderNode
Permissions Required: GlobalPermissions.Inventory.PurchaseOrder.EditPurchaseOrderNode

Status.description:
Purchase order status: PENDING - purchase order can be changed, not yet affecting stock levels
OPEN - purchase order is created and stock levels Due are reflected
PARTIAL - partially delivered 
DELIVERED - fully delivered

SearchValue.description: Specifies search value to filter with result set

SearchType.description: Specifies search value type for search value

EntriesPerPage.description: Number of records returned, sorted by Purchase Order Date

Search_PurchaseOrdersResult.description: Search_PurchaseOrders result class. Contains the Result - the list of returned purchase order headers, and current paging information

TotalNumberOfRecords.description: Total number of records matching the search request

pkPurchaseID.description: Unique identifier for the purchase order. You have to use this ID for all updates to the PO

fkSupplierId.description: Unique identifier for the supplier. Empty Guid is default supplier. Otherwise use Supplier API to get the names and additional data for the supplier

fkLocationId.description: Unique idenfidier of the location where the PO is expected to be delivered to. Empty Guid is default location. Use Locations API methods to get the names and additional details for the locations

Status.description:
Purchase order status. 
PENDING - purchase order can be changed, not yet affecting stock levels
OPEN - purchase order is created and stock levels Due are reflected
PARTIAL - partially delivered 
DELIVERED - fully delivered

Currency.description: Currency of the monetary values in the purchase order

SupplierReferenceNumber.description: Supplier reference number for the purchase order

Locked.description: Identified whether the PO is locked. This is for external application use only.

LineCount.description: Number of items in the purchase order

DeliveredLinesCount.description:
Count of all purchase order lines which are delivered 
(lines where some but not all of the stock has been received are counted as undelivered)

UnitAmountTaxIncludedType.description: Unit amount includes,exclud or no tax. 0 - Tax Exclusive cost, 1 - Cost Inclusive of tax, 2 - No Tax

DateOfPurchase.description: DateTime of the purchase order UTC

DateOfDelivery.description: DateTime of the purchase order delivered, will be set to DateOfPurchase until the PO is fully delivered UTC

QuotedDeliveryDate.description: DateTime of the purchase order qouted/expected delivery date UTC

PostagePaid.description:
**DEPRECIATED** 
Use additional costs with Shipping flag to record shipping costs. This field remains available in the API for backward compatibility and acts pretty much like an additional cost item with type id = 0

TotalCost.description: Total purchase price of the purchase order. Calculated from all purchase order items including tax and postage.

taxPaid.description: Total tax of the purchase order. Calculated from all purchase order items (excludes postage).

ShippingTaxRate.description:
**DEPRECIATED** 
Use additional costs with Shipping flag to record shipping costs. This field remains available in the API for backward compatibility and acts pretty much like an additional cost item with type id = 0

ConversionRate.description: Conversion rate of the purchase order currency. When PO is delivered Stock Value will be multipled by this conversion rate. For example if your system currency is GBP and Purchase order is in EUR the conversion rate is 0.81.

ConvertedShippingCost.description: Total shipping cost of the purchase order, converted to system currency

ConvertedShippingTax.description: Total shipping cost tax of the purchase order, converted to system currency

ConvertedOtherCost.description: Total amount of additional costs of the purchase order, converted to system currency

ConvertedOtherTax.description: Total tax amount of additional costs of the purchase order, converted to system currency

ConvertedGrandTotal.description: Total amount of the purchase order, converted to system currency

Status.description:
Purchase order status: PENDING - purchase order can be changed, not yet affecting stock levels
OPEN - purchase order is created and stock levels Due are reflected
PARTIAL - partially delivered 
DELIVERED - fully delivered

ReferenceLike.description: Purchase order reference or Supplier PO reference, works as a like will return all POs that contain ReferenceLike value

EntriesPerPage.description: Number of records returned, sorted by Purchase Order Date

Create_PurchaseOrder_InitialParameter.description: Class that represents entry parameters for creating new PENDING purchase order

fkSupplierId.description: Supplier unique identifier. Use Inventory/GetSupplierList to get the supplier ids

fkLocationId.description: Location id where the PO will be delivered to. Use Inventory/GetStockLocations to get the location ids

UnitAmountTaxIncludedType.description: Unit amount includes,excludes or no tax. 0 - Excludes Tax, 1 - Includes tax, 2 - No Tax

QuotedDeliveryDate.description: DateTime of the expected delivery date.

PostagePaid.description:
**DEPRECIATED** 
Use additional costs with Shipping flag to record shipping costs. This field remains available in the API for backward compatibility and acts pretty much like an additional cost item with type

ShippingTaxRate.description:
**DEPRECIATED** 
Use additional costs with Shipping flag to record shipping costs. This field remains available in the API for backward compatibility and acts pretty much like an additional cost item with type

ConversionRate.description: Currency conversion rate, multiplier to change the purchase order currency into the system currecny

Update_PurchaseOrderHeaderParameter.description: Change purchase order status. You can change from PENDING to OPEN, from OPEN to DELIVERED, from PARTIAL to DELIVERED

pkPurchaseID.description: Unique identifier for the purchase order. You have to use this ID for all updates to the PO

SupplierReferenceNumber.description: Supplier reference number for the purchase order

fkLocationId.description: Unique idenfidier of the location where the PO is expected to be delivered to. Empty Guid is default location. Use Locations API methods to get the names and additional details for the locations

fkSupplierId.description: Unique identifier for the supplier. Empty Guid is default supplier. Otherwise use Supplier API to get the names and additional data for the supplier

Currency.description: Currency of the values in the purchase order

UnitAmountTaxIncludedType.description: Unit amount includes,excludes or no tax. 0 - Excludes Tax, 1 - Includes tax, 2 - No Tax. Nullable if null, the value not updated

DateOfPurchase.description: DateTime of the purchase order delivered, will be set to DateOfPurchase until the PO is fully delivered UTC

QuotedDeliveryDate.description: DateTime of the purchase order quoted/expected delivery date UTC

ShippingTaxRate.description:
**DEPRECIATED** 
Use additional costs with Shipping flag to record shipping costs. This field remains available in the API for backward compatibility and acts pretty much like an additional cost item with type

ConversionRate.description: Conversion rate of the purchase order currency. When PO is delivered Stock Value will be multipled by this conversion rate. For example if your system currency is GBP and Purchase order is in EUR the conversion rate is 0.81.

PostagePaid.description:
**DEPRECIATED** 
Use additional costs with Shipping flag to record shipping costs. This field remains available in the API for backward compatibility and acts pretty much like an additional cost item with type

Modify_PurchaseOrderItems_BulkRequest.description: Request that contains lists to delete, add and update purchase order items

ItemsToAdd.description: New purchase order items to add

ItemsToDelete.description: Purchase order items to delete. PurchaseOrderItemId(s)

Id.description: unique row id, the same id will be returned to you in the response

StockItemId.description: pkStockItemId. Use Get Stock Item API call to get the id of a product by SKU or Title

Qty.description: Quantity of items in the purchase order line

Cost.description: Line Total cost of all the purchase order item inclusive of tax (unitcost * qty) + tax

PackQuantity.description: Number of items in a single pack. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

PackSize.description: Number of packs ordered. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

Id.description: unique row id, to uniquely identify submitted item. This Id will be returned in the response so you can match request to response items

StockItemId.description: pkStockItemId. Use Get Stock Item API call to get the id of a product by SKU or Title

Qty.description: Quantity of items in the purchase order line

Cost.description: Line Total cost of all the purchase order item inclusive of tax (unitcost * qty) + tax

PackQuantity.description: Number of items in a single pack. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

PackSize.description: Number of packs ordered. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

ModifiedItems.description: Modified purchase order items. Newly added items, updated items. Deleted items not returned back to the client.

Id.description: unique row id which was supplied in the ModifyPurchaseOrderItem, you can match this id to the request item. The same Id is returned to back from the request parameter

PurchaseItemId.description: Unique purchase order item id. Purchase order item is deleted and updated by PurchaseOrderItemId

StockItemId.description: pkStockItemId. Use Get Stock Item API call to get the id of a product by SKU or Title

Qty.description: Quantity of items in the purchase order line

Cost.description: Line Total cost of all the purchase order item inclusive of tax (unitcost * qty) + tax

PackQuantity.description: Number of items in a single pack. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

PackSize.description: Number of packs ordered. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

Add_PurchaseOrderItemParameter.description: Class represents parameter for adding line to the purchase order.

pkPurchaseId.description: Purchase order id. You can only add items to pending purchase orders

fkStockItemId.description: pkStockItemId. Use Get Stock Item API call to get the id of a product by SKU or Title

Qty.description: Quantity of items in the purchase order line

PackQuantity.description: Number of items in a single pack. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

PackSize.description: Number of packs ordered. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations.

Cost.description: Line Total cost of all the purchase order item inclusive of tax (unitcost * qty) + tax

Update_PurchaseOrderItemResponse.description: Response from update/add purchase order item, contains newly added purchase order item line and Purchase order header with recaluclated totals

BatchInventoryId.description:
If the item was batched or booked into a WMS location, this is the batch inventory id for the booked in stock. 
If an item was not delivered or was a non batched item, this will be null.

pkPurchaseItemId.description: Unique record identifier. Use this id to update quantity, cost, deliver item etc

fkStockItemId.description: Unique system stock identifier. Use this id to query linnworks api for product information, stock levels etc

Quantity.description: Quantity of unique stock items ordered

Cost.description: Line Total cost of all the purchase order item inclusive of tax (unitcost * qty) + tax

Delivered.description: Number of items delivered on the PO. If this number is more than 1, purchase order item cannot be deleted from the PO. Cannot be decreased.

TaxRate.description: Tax rate as a whole number, for example 20 represents 20%

PackQuantity.description: Arbitary identifier of how many packs ordered. Number not used in any of the calculation and purely for visualization and minimum reorder quantity purposes only

PackSize.description: Arbitary identifier of how many items in each pack. Number not used in any of the calculation and purely for visualization and minimum reorder quantity purposes only

InventoryTrackingType.description: Stock item tracking type. 0 = none. 1 = Ordered by Sell by Date. 2 = Ordered by Priority Sequence

IsDeleted.description: Whether or not the stock item for this purchase order item has been deleted in the system

SortOrder.description: Order the item was added to PO. First item = 0

QuantityBoundToOpenOrdersItems.description: Sum of quantity of items bound to open order items

StockItemIntId.description: Unique system stock integer identifier. Use this id to query linnworks api for product information, stock levels etc

BoundToOpenOrdersItems.description: Number of open order items this item is bound

SkuGroupIds.description: Sku group id assocaited with purchase item. Used for containerisation.

pkPurchaseItemId.description: Purchase order item unique row identifier

PackQuantity.description: Number of items in a single pack. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations. Optional

PackSize.description: Number of packs ordered. This is for reference purposes only. Not used for any calculations. Optional

Cost.description:
Line Total cost of all the purchase order item inclusive of tax (unitcost * qty) + tax. 
Value should be in the currency of the purchase order
(Optional) if not specified the cost will be recalculated from current cost specified on the PO

Delete_PurchaseOrderItemParameter.description: Delete purchase order item parameter. Purchase order items can only be deleted from PENDING Purchase Orders. Once PO is open, no modifications can be done

pkPurchaseItemId.description: Purchase order item unique row identifier

purchaseOrder.description: Purchase Order class made up of a Stock Item Id and a nullable Location Id

PurchaseOrderWithStockItem.description: List of Purchase Order Ids return using the Stock Item and Location Id parameters

StockItemId.description: The Id of the Stock Item

LocationIds.description: List of Location Ids to determine whether to return Purchase Order Ids based on stock location as well as Stock Item Id

AdditionalCosts.description: Count of notes on the purchase order

ConversionRate.description: Conversion rate from system currency, i.e. system currency rate to additional cost currency. For example if your system currency is GBP and additional cost is in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

TotalLineCost.description: Total cost, this is subtotal + tax (in system currency)

CostAllocation.description:
List of cost allocations. The list defines which PO items the additional cost will be attributed to. If the specific value is not entered, it means the cost is equaly distributed
The List is populated as part of Get_PurchaseOrder method

AllocationLocked.description: If this flag is set, new items added to PO will not be part of the allocation cost

AdditionalCostTypeIsShippingType.description: Indicate if the additional cost type is Shipping type

AdditionalCostTypeIsPartialAllocation.description: Indicate if the additional cost type allow partial allocation

Print.description: Indicate if the additional cost has to be shown in prints and emails

AllocationMethod.description: Indicate the method to calculate the allocation %  for each item

LineCost.description: Cost of the purchase order the payment contributes to

ConversionRate.description:
Conversion rate from system currency, i.e. system currency rate to additional cost currency.
For example if your system currency is GBP and payment statement cost is in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

CreationDate.description: Date when the payment statement was added

PaymentDate.description: Date when payment statement was marked as paid

fkPurchaseAdditionalCostItemId.description: Relation to additional cost line. If no value is set then the payment statement relates to PO supplier

PurchaseOrderAdditionalCostAllocation.description: Additional cost allocation item. Absence of an item means the cost is auto allocated equaly. If the cost allocation is specified the percentage is allocated to a specific PO line. If the cost allocation is 0%, means the cost not contribuiting to PO line

CostAllocationId.description: Allocation row id. Use this Id to update or delete specific record.

PurchaseItemId.description: Specific purchase order line id the cost is attributed to

AllocationPercentage.description: Percentage of the cost that will be attributed to Purchase order item id

pkPurchaseOrderNoteId.description: Unique identifier for the purchase order note. Use this ID in Delete/Modify calls

Note.description: Note text, 2000 chars max (longer notes are truncated)

changeStatusParameter.description: Class that represents the parameters for Changing the Purchase Order Status

Change_PurchaseOrderStatusParameter.description: Change purchase order status. You can change from PENDING to OPEN, from OPEN to DELIVERED, from PARTIAL to DELIVERED

status.description: Change purchase order status to the specified value

Deliver_PurchaseOrderItemAllNoBatchRespo.description: Response from delivering all items in an open/partial PO except Batch itesm

poHeaderAndItems.description: Delivered items and Recalculated purchase order header

allItemsDelivered.description: Set to true if all items in the PO have been marked as delivered

message.description: Informs customers why not all items have been marked as delivered

Deliver_PurchaseOrderItemAllResponse.description: Response from delivering all items in an open/partial PO

deliverItemParameter.description: Class that represents parameters for Deliver Purchase Item

Deliver_PurchaseItemParameter.description:
Add/change delivered quantity on the purchase order item. The PO status will automatically be changed to PARTIAL or DELIVERED 
You can use Delivered parameter to specify exact quantity of items delivered or 
AddToDelivered to add quantity to delivered

BatchNumber.description: If defined, this value will be used to apply the delivery to a batch

BinRack.description: If defined, this value will be used to apply the delivery to a batch

PrioritySequence.description: If defined, this value will be used to apply the delivery to a batch only when the batch in the provided binrack did not exist before.

BatchStatus.description: If defined, this value will be used to apply the delivery to a batch

pkPurchaseItemId.description: Purchase order item unique record identifier

Delivered.description: Exact quantity of items delivered. If AddToDelivered is specified this value must be null

AddToDelivered.description: Add quantity to delivered. If Delivered is specified this value must be null

auditLog.description: Class that represents parameters when searching the Audit Log

Search_PurchaseOrder_AuditLog.description: Class that represents parameters when searching the Audit Log

AuditTrailDateTimeStamp.description: When purchase order audit record was made

UserName.description: User whose actions are being audited

AuditTrailDate.description: Date when purchase order audit record was created

AuditTrailTime.description: Time when purchase order audit record was created

AddedDateTime.description: UTC date when the extended property was added

UserName.description: User name which added the extended property, if the property is updated it will not be changed from original

ExtendedPropertyItems.description: List of Extended Properties to be added to the purchase order

IsShippingType.description: Type of additional cost is shipping cost

IsPartialAllocation.description: Type must be 100% allocated to PO items

Print.description: Indicate if the additional costs of this type has to be printed

AllocationMethod.description: Indicate the method to calculate the allocation %  for each item

IsShippingType.description: Type of additional cost is shipping cost

IsPartialAllocation.description: Type must be 100% allocated to PO items

Print.description: Type must appear on prints and emails

AdditionalCostTypeId.description: Additional Cost type id to update

TypeName.description: Additional cost name, if null the field is not updated

IsShippingType.description: Type of additional cost is shipping cost, if null, the field is not updated

IsPartialAllocation.description: Type must be 100% allocated to PO items, if null, the field is not updated

Print.description: Type must appear on prints and emails

AdditionalCostTypeId.description: Additional cost type Ids to delete

itemsToAdd.description: list of additional cost items to add. Each item has Id which will be returned to you to match the item you are adding to array on your side

itemsToUpdate.description: List of items to update. Each line is identified by

itemsToDelete.description: List of items to delete, provide list of PurchaseAdditionalCostItemId's

Id.description: Each item in the request can have unique Id supplied (uniqueidentifier) this Id will be returned to you in the response so you can match request item with the response

ConversionRate.description: Conversion rate from system currency, i.e. system currency rate to additional cost currency. For example if your system currency is GBP and additional cost is in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

AllocationLocked.description: If this flag is set, new items added to PO will not be part of the allocation cost

Print.description: Indicate if the type will appear on prints and emaisl

PurchaseAdditionalCostItemId.description: Additional cost line row id, uniquely identifying each cost line

Id.description: Each item in the request can have unique Id supplied (uniqueidentifier) this Id will be returned to you in the response so you can match request item with the response

ConversionRate.description: Conversion rate from system currency, i.e. system currency rate to additional cost currency. For example if your system currency is GBP and additional cost is in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

AllocationLocked.description: If this flag is set, new items added to PO will not be part of the allocation cost

Print.description: Indicate if the type will appear on prints and emaisl

ModifiedItems.description: List of modified items, added or updated. Each item has Id which was provided in the request

PurchaseOrderHeader.description: Purchase order header with recalculated total

ModifiedAdditionalCostItem.description: Newly added purchase additional cost item

Id.description: Each item in the request can have unique Id supplied (uniqueidentifier) this Id will be returned to you in the response so you can match request item with the response

ConversionRate.description: Conversion rate from system currency, i.e. system currency rate to additional cost currency. For example if your system currency is GBP and additional cost is in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

TotalLineCost.description: Total cost, this is subtotal + tax (in system currency)

CostAllocation.description:
List of cost allocations. The list defines which PO items the additional cost will be attributed to. If the specific value is not entered, it means the cost is equaly distributed
The List is populated as part of Get_PurchaseOrder method

AllocationLocked.description: If this flag is set, new items added to PO will not be part of the allocation cost

AdditionalCostTypeIsShippingType.description: Indicate if the additional cost type is Shipping type

AdditionalCostTypeIsPartialAllocation.description: Indicate if the additional cost type allow partial allocation

Print.description: Indicate if the additional cost has to be shown in prints and emails

AllocationMethod.description: Indicate the method to calculate the allocation %  for each item

Get_Additional_CostRequest.description: Request class for getting purchase order additional costs

PurchaseId.description: Purchase order unique identifier of a PO

Modify_AdditionalCostAllocationRequest.description: Request contains items for modifyin, deleting and adding additional cost allocation items

PurchaseItemId.description: Specific purchase order line id the cost is attributed to

Id.description: unique row id, the same id will be returned to you in the response

AllocationPercentage.description: Percentage of the cost that will be attributed to Purchase order item id

CostAllocationId.description: Allocation row id that will be updated with the new AllocationPercentage

Id.description: unique row id, the same id will be returned to you in the response

AllocationPercentage.description: Percentage of the cost that will be attributed to Purchase order item id

ModifiedItems.description: list of modified items with Ids matched to CostAllocationId

Id.description: Relation to the initial request. This Id will match to what was specified in the request so that the client side can be updated with new CostAllocationIds

CostAllocationId.description: Allocation row id. Use this Id to update or delete specific record.

PurchaseItemId.description: Specific purchase order line id the cost is attributed to

AllocationPercentage.description: Percentage of the cost that will be attributed to Purchase order item id

itemsToAdd.description: list of payment statements to add. Each item has Id which will be returned to you to match the item you are adding to array on your side

itemsToUpdate.description: List of payment statements to update. Each line is identified by

itemsToDelete.description: List of payment statements to delete, provide list of PurchasePaymentStatementId's

Id.description: Each item in the request can have unique Id supplied (uniqueidentifier) this Id will be returned to you in the response so you can match request item with the response

LineCost.description: Cost of the purchase order the payment contributes to

PaymentDate.description: Date when payment statement was marked as paid

CreationDate.description: Date when the payment statement was added

PurchasePaymentStatementId.description: Payment Statement line row id, uniquely identifying each cost line

For example if your system currency is GBP and payment statementis in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

Conversion rate from system currency, i.e. system currency rate to additional cost currency.
For example if your system currency is GBP and payment statement cost is in USD the converted value is USD / Rate, example calculation, Rate 1.27, Additional cost total is 100, converted value = 100 USD / 1.27 = 78.98 GBP

PaymentDate.description: Date when payment statement was marked as paid

fkPurchaseAdditionalCostItemId.description: Relation to additional cost line. If no value is set then the payment statement relates to PO supplier

Get_PaymentStatementRequest.description: Request class for getting purchase order payment statements

PurchaseId.description: Purchase order unique identifier of a PO

ToCreate.description: A list of items that should either be added to a PO, either new or existing, depending on data

MyInventoryPOCreationItems.description: Object passed to the API to describe whether the item, on the base class, should be added to a new PO or an existing PO

IsNew.description: Denotes item should be added to a new PO

PurchaseOrderId.description: If this is populated with a valid PurchaseOrderId, the item will be added to that PO

OpenOrderItemsBound.description: List of open order items to be bound to the PO item

OustandingPOQuantity.description: The amount of stock that has been requested in POs, but not delivered

SuggestedReorderAmount.description: The amount that has been calculated to reorder, which can be based on reoder point functionality, the average of previous POs or up to minimum level

QuantityInDraftPOs.description: The amount of stock already in a PO in pending state

ImageURL.description: The main stock item image file name

SupplierAssigned.description: States whether an item has data for the requested supplier

CalculationMethod.description: This describes how the suggested order quantity was calculated

ErrorMessage.description: Description of any errors encountered while suggesting quantities

CanBeOrdered.description: Defines whether an item can be ordered if the item has an error associated with it

ErrorCode.description: Error code for the corresponding error message

SupplierPackSize.description: Pack size for the given item

MinimumOrderQuantity.description: Minimum Order Quantity for the given supplier

PurchaseOrders.description: A dictionary where the key is supplier Id and the tuple represents the purchase order id and the external invoice number for that PO
